intro: Parvatia decora, commonly known as the showy parvatia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and umbel-shaped inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Parvatia decora is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in its native habitat.
